6.21.howToFix:
Immediately hang up. 

Immediatly turn off your computer and leave it off. 

When a scammer gets access to your computer they can secretly keep that access and steal anything on your computer. They can also watch you as you log onto online banking or other services and steal your data. 

Contact a family member or a computer repair shop and explain what happened. They will be able to remove the scammers from your computer safetly.

5.14.howToFix:
Delete the offending email or move it to your spam folder.

If the email had contents you are concerned about and it seemed to be from a legitimate source you are familiar with and have business with, you can look up their number from and independent source like www.google.com or www.yahoo.ca.

You can also contact a trusted family member or friend for assistance.

If you need assistance you can press the back button at the top of the screen and press the call contact button.

6.18.howToFix:
Scammers are persistent and will possibly to try again pretending to be from a different organization. If this happens, immediately hang up. 

You can ask your phone provider for assistance in bloicking the scammers numbers if they continue to harass you.

4.3.question: Have you given them money, giftcards or personal information before
4.3.howToFix:
Immediately Hang-up and don’t answer if they call back. If they start to get angry or threaten you as you hang up this is most likely a scam. 

Once you hang up, if they were claiming to be from your bank or an organization that you trust, you should call that organization from a number you have previously used and trust or you should find the organizations number either using a phone booker searching for the organizatins number using a trusted search engine such as www.google.com or www.yahoo.ca. 

If you are uncomfortable with all of these options and the organization has a location near you, you could also go to the organizations physical location an ask for assistance in person.

6.14.howToFix:
Immediately close the window you are on and the web browser. 

Scammers will often try to lure in users pretending to be a legitimate ad, a message from a trusted business or posing as a system error. 

As a general rule, always immediately close a pop-up and never click on the contents of a pop-up. 

If you are getting a lot of pop-ups you should contact a computer store or family member/friend that is good with computers for assistance. 

If you feel like you are in need of assistance or press the back button at the top of the screen and press the call contact button

6.22.howToFix:
Do install anything or let them install anything on your computer. 

Legitimate companies will never call you asking for access to your computer. 

Don’t be alarmed if they get angry or threaten you when you hang up, this is an often used tactic by scammers. 

Don’t answer if you don’t recognize the number, scammers will often attempt to contact you by a different number if they notice your no longer answering the other one. 

If you need assistance you can press the back button at the top of the screen and press the call contact button.

4.4.question: Have you given them money, giftcards or personal information before?

5.11.question: Have they connected to or installed anything on your computer?
5.11.howToFix:
Scammers will often install screen sharing software so they can watch and control your screen remotely. They will then get you to log onto your banking information or bring up a square black window and get you to type amounts into it. 

They will then claim that too much money was transfered and demand that you compensate them for the mistake

5.9.question: Have you already given them anything of value including personal info.
5.9.howToFix:
Immediately Hang-up and don’t answer if they call back. If they start to get angry or threaten you as you hang up this is most likely a scam. 

Once you hang up, if they were claiming to be from your bank or an organization that you trust, you should call that organization from a number you have previously used and trust or you should find the organizations number either using a phonebook or searching for the organizatins number using a trusted search engine such as www.google.com or www.yahoo.ca. 

If you are uncomfortable with all of these options and the organization has a location near you, you could also go to the organizations physical location an ask for assistance in person.

6.19.howToFix:
If you wired them money through your bank, immediatly contact them from a number you have perviously used and trust.Tell them about the situation and they should be able to help. 

If you sent them items or money through the mail you could contact the post office and see if they can halt the package. 

If you gave them giftcard numbers you can call the connected organization ask to talk to customer service, then explain the situation. hopefully they can stop the scammers from using those codes. 

If you need assistance press the back button at the top of the page and then click on call contact.
